title: Soil Sample Search in Partially Observable Environments
abstract:
To work in unknown outdoor environments, autonomous sampling machines need
the ability to target samples despite limited visibility and robotic arm reach
distance. We design a heuristic guided search method to speed up the search
process and more efficiently localize the approximate center of soil regions.
Through simulation experiments, we assess the effectiveness of the proposed
algorithm and discover superior performance in terms of speed, distance
traveled, and success rate compared to naive baselines.
